grebrew: נֶפֶשׁ כִּֽי־תִמְעֹל מַעַל וְחָֽטְאָה בִּשְׁגָגָה מִקָּדְשֵׁי יְהוָה וְהֵבִיא אֶת־אֲשָׁמוֹ לַֽיהוָה אַיִל תָּמִים מִן־הַצֹּאן בְּעֶרְכְּךָ כֶּֽסֶף־שְׁקָלִים בְּשֶֽׁקֶל־הַקֹּדֶשׁ לְאָשָֽׁם׃

Kah ne ummatcheseonk, papaume nish ‹wanetupanatamweyeúꝏ̄g›, pish [ô]adtehteau, kah napanna audtahshe chippag, na pish ukkꝏ̄tnehteauun, kah pish wuttinnumauon ‹sephausuaénuh›: kah sephausuaen pish ꝏ̄nauwadtuwáheuh, nashpe ram wutch matcheseongane sephausuonk, kah pish kittummontea[n]umwe «ahquoantamauun.
»

rawKJV: And he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.
grebrew: וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר חָטָא מִן־הַקֹּדֶשׁ יְשַׁלֵּם וְאֶת־חֲמִֽישִׁתוֹ יוֹסֵף עָלָיו וְנָתַן אֹתוֹ לַכֹּהֵן וְהַכֹּהֵן יְכַפֵּר עָלָיו בְּאֵיל הָאָשָׁם וְנִסְלַח לֽוֹ׃

grebrew: וְאִם־נֶפֶשׁ כִּי תֶֽחֱטָא וְעָֽשְׂתָה אַחַת מִכָּל־מִצְוֺת יְהוָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֵעָשֶׂינָה וְלֹֽא־יָדַע וְאָשֵׁם וְנָשָׂא עֲוֺנֽוֹ׃

rawKJV: And Moses spake unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons that were left, Take the meat offering that remaineth of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar: for it is most holy:

rawKJV: And the wave breast and heave shoulder shall ye eat in «a» clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee: for they be thy due, and thy sons' due, which are given out of the sacrifices of peace offerings of the children of Israel.
grebrew: וְאֵת חֲזֵה הַתְּנוּפָה וְאֵת ׀ שׁוֹק הַתְּרוּמָה תֹּֽאכְלוּ בְּמָקוֹם טָהוֹר אַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ וּבְנֹתֶיךָ אִתָּךְ כִּֽי־חָקְךָ וְחָק־בָּנֶיךָ נִתְּנוּ מִזִּבְחֵי שַׁלְמֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃

grebrew: שׁוֹק הַתְּרוּמָה וַחֲזֵה הַתְּנוּפָה עַל אִשֵּׁי הַחֲלָבִים יָבִיאוּ לְהָנִיף תְּנוּפָה לִפְנֵי יְהוָה וְהָיָה לְךָ וּלְבָנֶיךָ אִתְּךָ לְחָק־עוֹלָם כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה יְהוָֽה׃

rawKJV: And Moses diligently sought the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burnt: and he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron which were left alive, saying,
grebrew: וְאֵת ׀ שְׂעִיר הַֽחַטָּאת דָּרֹשׁ דָּרַשׁ מֹשֶׁה וְהִנֵּה שֹׂרָף וַיִּקְצֹף עַל־אֶלְעָזָר וְעַל־אִֽיתָמָר בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַנּוֹתָרִם לֵאמֹֽר׃

rawKJV: Wherefore have ye «not» eaten the sin offering in the holy place, seeing it is most holy, and God hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the LORD?
grebrew: מַדּוּעַ לֹֽא־אֲכַלְתֶּם אֶת־הַֽחַטָּאת בִּמְקוֹם הַקֹּדֶשׁ כִּי קֹדֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁים הִוא וְאֹתָהּ ׀ נָתַן לָכֶם לָשֵׂאת אֶת־עֲוֺן הָעֵדָה לְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיהֶם לִפְנֵי יְהוָֽה׃

grebrew: אָדָם כִּֽי־יִהְיֶה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂרוֹ שְׂאֵת אֽוֹ־סַפַּחַת אוֹ בַהֶרֶת וְהָיָה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂרוֹ לְנֶגַע צָרָעַת וְהוּבָא אֶל־אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן אוֹ אֶל־אַחַד מִבָּנָיו הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃

rawFirstEdition: Kah sephausuaen pish ‹ukkehkiñeaumun›, enninneaonk ut ‹wuttuhquabèe› weyausut, kah wishshuwussuongash ut ‹aninneaonganit›, wompag, kah moneaumunat aninneaonk, ‹mꝏ̄nâushik› onk ne ‹wadtúhquabée› weyaus, ne wutchekꝏ̄e aninneaonk: kah sephausuaen pish ‹wunnáumun›, kah ukkenꝏ̄tamun ne nishkeneunkquok.

rawKJV: And the priest shall look on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and when the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight be deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is «a» plague of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.
grebrew: וְרָאָה הַכֹּהֵן אֶת־הַנֶּגַע בְּעֽוֹר־הַבָּשָׂר וְשֵׂעָר בַּנֶּגַע הָפַךְ ׀ לָבָן וּמַרְאֵה הַנֶּגֶע עָמֹק מֵעוֹר בְּשָׂרוֹ נֶגַע צָרַעַת הוּא וְרָאָהוּ הַכֹּהֵן וְטִמֵּא אֹתֽוֹ׃

rawFirstEdition: Kah sephausuen pish nemunau pasukꝏ̄ nomposhimwe lamboh, kah pish sephausinneuh wutch panneseáe sephausuonk, kah wunnonteamése pummee, kah pish papaumenumun wutch papaumenumwe sephausuonk, ut anaquabit Jehovah.

rawKJV: And if «a» «woman» approach unto any beast, and lie down thereto, thou shalt kill the «woman», and the beast: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
grebrew: וְאִשָּׁה אֲשֶׁר תִּקְרַב אֶל־כָּל־בְּהֵמָה לְרִבְעָה אֹתָהּ וְהָרַגְתָּ אֶת־הָאִשָּׁה וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָתוּ דְּמֵיהֶם בָּֽם׃

rawFirstEdition: Kah wosketomp noh nemunont weetahtu, wuttaunoh ꝏ̄shoh, asuh ohkasoh wuttaunoh, kah ‹naumóa[t]éhettit› ukk[ó]ussuonk, ne «panneusseuonk», kah nag pish tummetahwhôog, anaquabhettit wunnaumonáoh ummissinninneumꝏ̄oh: noh woshwunum weetattu ukkôussuonk, noh pish nayeutam ummatcheseonk.

rawKJV: And if «a» man shall take his sister, his father's daughter, or his mother's daughter, and see her nakedness, and she see his nakedness; it is «a» wicked thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of their people: he hath uncovered his sister's nakedness; he shall bear his iniquity.
grebrew: וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִקַּח אֶת־אֲחֹתוֹ בַּת־אָבִיו אוֹ בַת־אִמּוֹ וְרָאָה אֶת־עֶרְוָתָהּ וְהִֽיא־תִרְאֶה אֶת־עֶרְוָתוֹ חֶסֶד הוּא וְנִכְרְתוּ לְעֵינֵי בְּנֵי עַמָּם עֶרְוַת אֲחֹתוֹ גִּלָּה עֲוֺנוֹ יִשָּֽׂא׃

rawKJV: And if «a» man shall lie with «a» «woman» having her sickness, and shall uncover her nakedness; he hath discovered her fountain, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blood: and both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
grebrew: וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִשְׁכַּב אֶת־אִשָּׁה דָּוָה וְגִלָּה אֶת־עֶרְוָתָהּ אֶת־מְקֹרָהּ הֶֽעֱרָה וְהִיא גִּלְּתָה אֶת־מְקוֹר דָּמֶיהָ וְנִכְרְתוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם מִקֶּרֶב עַמָּֽם׃

rawKJV: And thou shalt «not» uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister, nor of thy father's sister: for he uncovereth his near kin: they shall bear their iniquity.
grebrew: וְעֶרְוַת אֲחוֹת אִמְּךָ וַאֲחוֹת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה כִּי אֶת־שְׁאֵרוֹ הֶעֱרָה עֲוֺנָם יִשָּֽׂאוּ׃

rawKJV: Even unto the morrow after the seventh sabbath shall ye number fifty days; and ye shall offer «a» new meat offering unto the LORD.

rawFirstEdition: Wutch kekꝏ̄óut, pish kuppaudtomwꝏ̄ petukqununk wutch paupaumenumwe sephausuonk, neesinash petukqunegash, wutch nesinash piogque chippagish, nish pish pashquag nꝏ̄khik: nish pish «apwhôsuoash» nashpe seog, nish «kakeneumuneash» en Jehovah$ut.

rawKJV: Ye shall bring out of your habitations two wave loaves of two tenth deals; they shall be of fine flour; they shall be baken with leaven; they are the firstfruits unto the LORD.
grebrew: מִמּוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם תָּבִיאּוּ ׀ לֶחֶם תְּנוּפָה שְׁתַּיִם שְׁנֵי עֶשְׂרֹנִים סֹלֶת תִּהְיֶינָה חָמֵץ תֵּאָפֶינָה בִּכּוּרִים לֽ͏ַיהוָֽה׃

rawFirstEdition: Káh pish kenashpe sephausimwꝏ̄ petukqunnunk, nesausuk tahsuog nomposhimwe ‹pànnuppée› lambsog, negonne kodtumuk, kah pasuk oxen wuskoshimꝏ̄m wutch herdut, kah neesuog ramsog: nag pish chikohtae sephausuonk, en Jehovah$ut, kah metsue sephausuonk, kah ‹wuttattamôé› sephausuongash nish n[e]h wadchiigish, chikohtae sephausuonk ne weetemungquok en Jehovahut.

rawKJV: And ye shall offer with the bread seven lambs without blemish of the first year, and one young bullock, and two rams: they shall be for «a» burnt offering unto the LORD, with their meat offering, and their drink offerings, even an offering made by fire, of sweet savour unto the LORD.
grebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּם עַל־הַלֶּחֶם שִׁבְעַת כְּבָשִׂים תְּמִימִם בְּנֵי שָׁנָה וּפַר בֶּן־בָּקָר אֶחָד וְאֵילִם שְׁנָיִם יִהְיוּ עֹלָה לַֽיהוָה וּמִנְחָתָם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶם אִשֵּׁה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹחַ לַיהוָֽה׃

rawKJV: These are the feasts of the LORD, which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, to offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD, «a» burnt offering, and «a» meat offering, «a» sacrifice, and drink offerings, every thing upon his day:
grebrew: אֵלֶּה מוֹעֲדֵי יְהוָה אֲשֶׁר־תִּקְרְאוּ אֹתָם מִקְרָאֵי קֹדֶשׁ לְהַקְרִיב אִשֶּׁה לַיהוָה עֹלָה וּמִנְחָה זֶבַח וּנְסָכִים דְּבַר־יוֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃

grebrew: מִלְּבַד שַׁבְּתֹת יְהוָה וּמִלְּבַד מַתְּנֽוֹתֵיכֶם וּמִלְּבַד כָּל־נִדְרֵיכֶם וּמִלְּבַד כָּל־נִדְבוֹתֵיכֶם אֲשֶׁר תִּתְּנוּ לַיהוָֽה׃

rawKJV: Also in the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when ye have gathered in the fruit of the land, ye shall keep «a» feast unto the LORD seven days: on the first day shall be «a» sabbath, and on the eighth day shall be «a» sabbath.
grebrew: אַךְ בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם לַחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי בְּאָסְפְּכֶם אֶת־תְּבוּאַת הָאָרֶץ תָּחֹגּוּ אֶת־חַג־יְהוָה שִׁבְעַת יָמִים בַּיּוֹם הָֽרִאשׁוֹן שַׁבָּתוֹן וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי שַׁבָּתֽוֹן׃

grebrew: בִּשְׁנַת הַיּוֹבֵל הַזֹּאת תָּשֻׁבוּ אִישׁ אֶל־אֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃

rawFirstEdition: Kah ne teag ‹kodtówompásean› en «kematut», asuh adtôaan ut ketatteamung wunnutcheganit, ahque howan «wussaumassômonch» weematoh.

rawKJV: According to the multitude of years thou shalt increase the price thereof, and according to the fewness of years thou shalt diminish the price of it: for according to the number of the years of the fruits doth he sell unto thee.
grebrew: לְפִי ׀ רֹב הַשָּׁנִים תַּרְבֶּה מִקְנָתוֹ וּלְפִי מְעֹט הַשָּׁנִים תַּמְעִיט מִקְנָתוֹ כִּי מִסְפַּר תְּבוּאֹת הוּא מֹכֵר לָֽךְ׃

rawKJV: Wherefore ye shall do my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do them; and ye shall dwell in the land in safety.

rawKJV: As long as it lieth desolate it shall rest; because it did «not» rest in your sabbaths, when ye dwelt upon it.
grebrew: כָּל־יְמֵי הָשַׁמָּה תִּשְׁבֹּת אֵת אֲשֶׁר לֹֽא־שָׁבְתָה בְּשַׁבְּתֹתֵיכֶם בְּשִׁבְתְּכֶם עָלֶֽיהָ׃

rawFirstEdition: Kah nag asqunnumauun[ó]gig, pish ‹nuppadtauoog› ‹sauunnumóonk› ut wuttahhꝏ̄wóut, ut wutohtuóut ummatwomꝏ̄oh, kah «wunnishketunkqussuonk» touanuhhog wunnepog, pish wunꝏ̄sukongquneau, kah nag pish wussémoog onatuh wasemuk wutch togkodteg, kah nag pish penushaog, wanne howan wunnaumatuhkauonk.

rawKJV: And upon them that are left alive of you I will send «a» faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of «a» shaken leaf shall chase them; and they shall flee, as fleeing from «a» sword; and they shall fall when none pursueth.
grebrew: וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִים בָּכֶם וְהֵבֵאתִי <H>מֹרֶךְ</H> בִּלְבָבָם בְּאַרְצֹת אֹיְבֵיהֶם וְרָדַף אֹתָם קוֹל עָלֶה נִדָּף וְנָסוּ מְנֻֽסַת־חֶרֶב וְנָפְלוּ וְאֵין רֹדֵֽף׃

rawKJV: And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:
